title: Directs the chancellor of the city school district of city over 1 million to inventory and report on the outdoor schoolyards of such district
summary: Directs the chancellor of the city school district of a city over 1 million to inventory and report on the outdoor schoolyards of such district.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          587

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sens.  KLEIN,  DIAZ, HASSELL-THOMPSON, HUNTLEY, KRUEGER,
         MONTGOMERY, SAMPSON -- read twice and ordered printed, and when print-
         ed to be committed to the Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to directing the chancel-
         lor of a city school district in a city having  a  population  of  one
         million  or  more to inventory and report upon the outdoor schoolyards
         within such district

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  2556 of the education law is amended by adding a
    2  new subdivision 14 to read as follows:
    3    14. A.  THE CHANCELLOR OF A CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT IN A  CITY  HAVING  A
    4  POPULATION  OF  ONE  MILLION  OR  MORE SHALL COMPILE AN INVENTORY OF AND
    5  ISSUE A WRITTEN REPORT ABOUT THE OUTDOOR SCHOOLYARDS IN THE CITY  SCHOOL
    6  DISTRICT. SUCH INVENTORY AND REPORT SHALL:
    7    (I)  IDENTIFY  EACH  OUTDOOR SCHOOLYARD LOCATED AT EDUCATIONAL FACILI-
    8  TIES, AS DEFINED IN SUBDIVISION  NINE  OF  SECTION  TWENTY-FIVE  HUNDRED
    9  NINETY-A  OF  THIS  TITLE,  OF  THE  CITY  SCHOOL DISTRICT. EACH OUTDOOR
   10  SCHOOLYARD SHALL BE IDENTIFIED BY THE COMMUNITY SCHOOL DISTRICT IN WHICH
   11  THE OUTDOOR SCHOOLYARD IS LOCATED, ITS  ADDRESS,  APPROXIMATE  SIZE  AND
   12  PHYSICAL CONDITION;
   13    (II)  IDENTIFY  WHICH OUTDOOR SCHOOLYARDS ARE USED FOR PHYSICAL EDUCA-
   14  TION, ACTIVITY AND/OR RECREATION; FOR EACH SUCH  OUTDOOR  SCHOOLYARD,  A
   15  DESCRIPTION  OF  HOW  OFTEN STUDENTS OF THE CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT USE THE
   16  OUTDOOR SCHOOLYARD, THE ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED, AND ANY LIMITATIONS ON THE
   17  USES OF THE SCHOOLYARD;
   18    (III) IDENTIFY WHICH OUTDOOR SCHOOLYARDS ARE  NOT  USED  FOR  PHYSICAL
   19  EDUCATION, ACTIVITY OR RECREATION. FOR EACH SUCH SCHOOLYARD, AN EXPLANA-
   20  TION OF WHY IT IS NOT BEING USED FOR PHYSICAL EDUCATION, PHYSICAL ACTIV-
   21  ITY OR RECREATION BY STUDENTS OF THE CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT;

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04766-01-1

       S. 587                              2

    1    (IV) WHETHER EACH OUTDOOR SCHOOLYARD IS USED AND THE FREQUENCY OF SUCH
    2  USE  DURING  THE  SCHOOL  DAY  AND  WHETHER  IT  IS AVAILABLE FOR USE BY
    3  STUDENTS OR THE GENERAL PUBLIC DURING AFTER SCHOOL HOURS;
    4    (V)  FOR  EACH  OUTDOOR SCHOOLYARD, A DESCRIPTION OF THE CAPITAL PLANS
    5  FOR CONSTRUCTION, PLACEMENT, RENOVATION AND/OR RECONFIGURATION  THEREOF,
    6  AND  ANY  PLAN  TO INCREASE OR DECREASE THE AVAILABILITY AND UTILIZATION
    7  THEREOF; AND
    8    (VI) ANY OTHER FACTS, INFORMATION AND RECOMMENDATIONS WHICH THE  CHAN-
    9  CELLOR  DEEMS NECESSARY TO IMPROVE THE OUTDOOR SCHOOLYARDS OF THE EDUCA-
   10  TIONAL FACILITIES OF THE CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT. SUCH  IMPROVEMENTS  SHALL
   11  BE  THOSE  THAT  ENHANCE  THE  PHYSICAL  EDUCATION,  PHYSICAL AND MENTAL
   12  FITNESS, AND WELL-BEING OF THE STUDENTS OF THE CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT.
   13    B. ON OR BEFORE DECEMBER THIRTY-FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE, THE  CHAN-
   14  CELLOR SHALL SUBMIT THE INVENTORY AND REPORT, COMPILED PURSUANT TO PARA-
   15  GRAPH A OF THIS SUBDIVISION, TO THE GOVERNOR, THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF
   16  THE SENATE, THE SPEAKER OF THE ASSEMBLY AND THE DEPARTMENT.
   17    C.  FOR  THE  PURPOSES OF THIS SUBDIVISION, "OUTDOOR SCHOOLYARD" MEANS
   18  OUTDOOR SPACE WHICH IS LOCATED AT EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES, AND IS USED OR
   19  INTENDED TO BE USED BY STUDENTS FOR PHYSICAL EDUCATION, PHYSICAL  ACTIV-
   20  ITY AND/OR RECREATION.
   21    S  2.  Section  2590-h of the education law is amended by adding a new
   22  subdivision 52 to read as follows:
   23    52. TO COMPILE AN INVENTORY OF AND ISSUE A WRITTEN  REPORT  ABOUT  THE
   24  OUTDOOR SCHOOLYARDS IN THE CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT, AS REQUIRED BY SUBDIVI-
   25  SION FOURTEEN OF SECTION TWENTY-FIVE HUNDRED FIFTY-SIX OF THIS TITLE.
   26    S  3. This act shall take effect immediately, provided that the amend-
   27  ments to section 2590-h of the education law, made  by  section  two  of
   28  this  act,  shall  not  affect  the expiration of such section and shall
   29  expire therewith.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to directing the chancellor of a city school district in a city having a population of one million or more to inventory and report upon the outdoor schoolyards within such district
